definition: to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: That series s selling point was not just sex and designer clothes.
sentences.chinese: 这一电视剧的卖点不仅只是性和名牌服装。

sentences.english: One of the game's big selling points is its action-oriented movement.
sentences.chinese: 这款游戏的最大的卖点在于动感十足。

sentences.english: BUY, Buy more American obsolete weapons, then re-sale them to the Philippines.
sentences.chinese: 买吧，多买点美国过时的武器吧，再卖点给菲律宾。

sentences.english: It might be a selling point.
The chief attraction of the device is the ease with which it can be used to buy books and other content.
sentences.chinese: 它主要的卖点就是能方便地买书和其他内容。

sentences.english: Some prisoners also sell handicrafts they have made or pictures they've drawn.
sentences.chinese: 有些囚犯也会卖点自己制作的手工品或绘制的图画。

sentences.english: The problem for Sony now is that the sheer weight of USPs is against them.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在困扰索尼的问题是卖点完全不在他们一边。

sentences.english: Teaching in English is the selling point of the local education system.
sentences.chinese: 英语教学是本港教育制度的卖点。

sentences.english: The idea of an upgradable machine was a big selling point back then.
sentences.chinese: 一台可升级的机器”在当时是一个大卖点。

sentences.english: At the same time, also highlighted the better the "Golden River, the quality of" selling points.
sentences.chinese: 同时也更好的突出了“金沙河，金品质”的卖点。

sentences.english: The biggest selling point of crystal is not only in the purity, but also in the gorgeous cut.
sentences.chinese: 其最大的卖点就是晶体之纯净与切割之华丽工整。

sentences.english: GPS used to be the USP of high-end handsets.
By 1598, his name had become a selling point and began to appear on the title pages.
sentences.chinese: 到1598年，他的名字已经成为卖点并出现在扉页。

sentences.english: Come on, ride off to town, and get money for the horse, or make a good bargain with it.
sentences.chinese: 你骑着它到镇上，把马卖点钱，或者换点好东西吧。

sentences.english: Eventually the store will be one of the key selling points in marketing of new devices.
sentences.chinese: 最终商店会成为新设备营销过程中的一大卖点。

sentences.english: Higher rate of the selling points of many projects.
sentences.chinese: 较高的绿化率是许多楼盘的卖点。

definition: amusing speech or act/jokes/antics/funny/amusing/Taiwan pr. [xue1 tou2]
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
